subject: Communication
title: Listening Without Fixing
description: A 60-second lesson on Listening Without Fixing.

hook.text: 'I don't need you to fix it. I just need you to hear me.' The hardest listening skill isn't technique.

buildup.text: Many listeners jump to advice: 'Have you tried this?' or 'You should do that.' This blocks real connection.

discovery.text: Research shows that unsolicited advice makes people feel unheard and patronized.

twist.text: Men are statistically more likely to offer solutions; women more likely to offer emotional support.

climax.text: The skill: ask 'Do you want advice, or do you need me to listen?

punchline.text: Sometimes the most helpful thing isn't an answer. It's an ear.

quiz.question: Why does unsolicited advice often backfire?
options: It makes people feel unheard and patronized
People don't like being told what to do
